Authors:
Stella Maris Romero, Ricardo M. Comerio, Viviana Andrea
Barrera, Andrea Irene Romero
Title:
Aspergillus fuscicans, a new species in section Usti from
Argentinean semi-arid soil
Abstract:
The discovery of an interesting new species within
Aspergillus section Usti is proposed from Argentinean semi-arid soil.
Aspergillus fuscicans sp. nov. formed a well-defined clade related to A.
calidoustus and A. pseudodeflectus based on sequence analysis of BenA
and CaM markers. Morphological and physiological examination of
Argentinean isolates indicated that they are able to grow above 37Â°C, in
contrast with A. ustus isolates; and give a negative Ehrlich reaction in
contrast with the related species A. calidoustus. Combined morphological
and physiological features are sufficient to distinguish the new species
from related taxa.
